page.title: 10KIRKELLA COUNTRYSIDE
page.content: To the west and north of Kirkella there is open countryside for several miles.The main land cover is cereal crops(especially barley) closely followed by fields for grazing animals .There were several sizeable clumps of mixed woodland,but no commercial plantion.Occupying a large chunk in the centre of our area was Hull Golf club centering Kirkella.The farms are the main source of employment in the area (apart from one chalk quarry) . The farmers in the main have retained the traditional small field surrounded by hedgerows.Most farms are mixed farms,growing cereal crops and keeping animals chiefly cows or pigs.A few farms went in for some market gardening growing lettuce,tomatoes or strawberries and raspberries. The only 'wild'land was along the old disused Hull to Barnsley railway.
